briefdescription.para: Normal multi-threaded applications should not need these the predicates from this section because almost any usage of these predicates is unsafe.

detaileddescription.para: For example checking the existence of a thread before signalling it is of no use as it may vanish between the two calls Catching exceptions using catch/3 is the only safe way to deal with thread-existence errors
These predicates are provided for diagnosis and monitoring tasks
